list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He was in a funk over his exam.

list_definition.definition: not to do (something) because one is afraid

list_ex_of_english: I am not going to funk any question.
They should not ask the tobacco industry to take a decision that they are funking.
The first is, out of sheer funk, to panic; and that is the quickest way to disaster.
They funked the decision when they should have taken it.
There is widespread belief throughout the fishing industry that they will be funked.
As we have already seen, he has decided to funk on taking responsibility for alienating the motorist.
They funked a decision on peacetime conscription, and then at long last they took one, and then ran away from it.
